newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Ringgit eases against dollar on covering.
newsitem.headline: Ringgit eases against dollar on covering.

text.p: The ringgit eased against the dollar on Friday as players squared their short-dollar positions ahead of the weekend, dealers said.

"The ringgit is taking a breather. This is expected as its rise has been quite drastic," said a local bank dealer in Kuala Lumpur. The ringgit jumped about 400 points this week to an eight-month high of 2.4800 a dollar on Thursday.
Its rise was capped by commercial dollar demand and speculation of intervention by Bank Negara Malaysia.
At 1000 GMT, the ringgit was at 2.4848/55 a dollar against 2.4805/15 at close of Kuala Lumpur on Thursday.

Dealers said the ringgit rise on Thursday was helped by a news report which quoted Deputy Finance Minister Affifuddin Omar as saying the government was comfortable with the recent strengthening of the ringgit.

Demand for the ringgit has picked up significantly following a survey of financial institutions in Singapore and London which showed that the Malaysian unit was likely to be the most favoured Asian currency this year.
A Singapore-based European bank dealer said a lot of U.S. funds were switching from the Singapore dollar into the ringgit.
